Managed to get my friend killed by throwing firecrackers in front of his locker.

11/10 would throw my friends under the bus again.

Its a good game... mostly.  The idea is awesome and the execution... mostly good.

If you like games that are buggy, a little bit broken and have a mostly toxic player base, then its the right game for you.

Its a lot more fun with friends, and the custom game option is really great to get new players into it as long as they have friends who play it too.

I'm not saying its a terrible game, like I said, its an awesome idea, just not executed that well.  It's got its good sides and its downsides - like any game I suppose.

If you want to play with any really decent perks, you'll have to spend money to get the DLC or just wait, save your shards and hope you get lucky in the Shrine of Secrets.  Heads up, most of the time you don't.

I do enjoy this game, and I would recommend it, just don't go into every game expecting to have a great time.

Dead by Daylight:

brabo.

Toxic community with bizarre "latency" under their so-called dedicated server. Game's been released for 3 years and they still can't get the hitbox right.  Their useless devs are even claiming that 150ms is good ping (for a game with shooting actions). It's a shame that they've got this amazing game concept while ruining it with terrible optimization by their incompetent devs.

Might be my new favorite game of all time. 40 hrs in and im not ever a little bit bored of it!

Update: 100 hours in. I can now safely say this is my favorite game of all time. Both survivor and killer are incredibly fun to play. I just wish Behavior would release more DLC at a quicker rate, take my money please!

Update: 190 hours in. I love this game and its community.
can't speak for competitive playing but just to play a few rounds of with my friends it's usually a pretty good time
